intro: Commelina livingstonii var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture, and it produces small, delicate flowers that bloom in clusters. It is a member of the Commelinaceae family, known for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
